page.title: 09Farm Cottages-Eaton,Henwood
page.content: Two {Victorian}style cottages once tied to Bradley's farm have recently been extended in the same red brick and retaining the original style. In Wootton the cottages belonging to Manor Farm were sold years ago when the land was sold. Recently Myrtyl Cottage has been bought as a{weekend {home} and Tommy's Farm, which is no longer a farm house is being renovated at enormous expense as a family home. In Eaton several houses were built for farm workers in 1865 but today only two are still tied to a farm. One came into private ownership in an unusual way. The farm worker who was the tenant was dismissed for stealing and evicted. When the case was investigated he was declared innocent but he refused to be re-instated. As compensation he was given the cottage in which he had been a tenant.
